intro: Diplasia pycnostachya, commonly known as the dense-stalked Diplasia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy inflorescences. The plant features opposite leaves that are often hairy, and its flowers are typically clustered in dense spikes. Diplasia pycnostachya is adapted to grow in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates.
